greek_pasta_salad.name: Greek Tortellini Pasta Salad
greek_pasta_salad.description: A refreshing and flavorful Greek pasta salad tossed in a zesty lemon-herb dressing.
instructions: In a small bowl or jar, combine all dressing ingredients: olive oil, apple cider vinegar, garlic, oregano, basil, thyme, sugar, Dijon mustard, and lemon juice. Mix or shake well until emulsified.
Cook tortellini to al dente according to package instructions. Rinse with cold water and set aside to cool.
Finely chop the red onion, artichoke hearts, and basil. Peel cucumber, slice into rounds, then quarter the slices.
In a large bowl, combine cooled tortellini, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, olives, artichokes, and feta.
Pour dressing over the salad and toss until well coated.
Refrigerate for 3-6 hours for best flavor. Toss again before serving.

buffalo_spaghetti_squash.name: Buffalo Chicken Spaghetti Squash
buffalo_spaghetti_squash.description: A delicious way to enjoy vegetables that tastes just like buffalo wings—without the guilt.
ingredients: 4 oz low fat shredded cheddar cheese
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F. Slice spaghetti squash in half lengthwise, scoop out seeds, and roast cut-side down on a baking sheet for 35-45 minutes until tender.
While the squash is roasting, season chicken with salt and pepper. Cook on stovetop or bake until fully cooked, then shred.
In a large bowl, mix shredded chicken with hot sauce and ranch.
Once squash is done, use a fork to shred into noodles. Add to bowl with the buffalo chicken mixture and toss gently.
Fold in shredded cabbage and scallions. Transfer to a baking dish or back into squash skins if preferred.
Top with cheddar cheese and return to the oven for 10-15 minutes, until cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve warm and enjoy!

buffalo_chicken_dip.name: Buffalo Chicken Dip
buffalo_chicken_dip.description: A staple party snack and an amazing side dish with a spicy, creamy kick.
instructions: Lightly season chicken with salt and pepper.
Cook chicken on the stovetop until done, then shred.
In a saucepan over medium heat, combine all ingredients and stir constantly.
Once the cheese is melted and everything is heated through (about 10-15 minutes), serve warm and enjoy!

fish_tacos.name: Spicy Fish Tacos
fish_tacos.description: A simple and satisfying fish taco dinner with a light, zesty slaw.
instructions: Pat the fish dry and season both sides with salt and pepper.
In a bowl, mix the zest of half a lime with cornstarch, paprika, chili powder, harissa, and cayenne.
Evenly coat the fish with the spice mixture, rubbing it in gently.
Heat neutral oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the fish for 3-4 minutes per side, until golden and crispy.
Set the fish aside on a paper towel to cool. Once cooled, shred into bite-sized pieces.
In a bowl, mix cabbage, cilantro, green onion, juice from 1-2 limes (about 2 tablespoons), olive oil, salt, and pepper to taste.
Assemble tacos using the tortillas, fish, and slaw. Serve immediately.

egg_avocado_toast.name: Over-Easy Egg and Avocado Toast
egg_avocado_toast.description: Easy and quick early morning breakfast with healthy fats and protein.
instructions: Mash avocado and mix in cayenne, bagel seasoning, salt, and pepper.
In a pan over medium heat, melt half the butter and toast the bread to your preferred crispiness.
Spread the seasoned avocado mash on the toast and set aside.
Add the remaining butter to the pan and cook the egg to your desired doneness (over medium with a runny yolk is recommended).
Place the egg on top of the toast and serve immediately.

balsamic_brussels.name: Balsamic Brussels Sprouts
balsamic_brussels.description: An easy, fast side dish that tastes like you put a ton of effort into it.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Halve all Brussels sprouts and place on a large baking pan (all sprouts should touch the bottom of the pan).
Massage in olive oil, ensuring all sprouts have a light, even coat. Then season with salt and pepper.
Place in oven and roast for 30-45 minutes until lightly charred and crispy.
While roasting, reduce balsamic vinegar over medium-low heat, stirring constantly, until it thickens into a glaze.
(Optional) Cook bacon at 375°F for 40-45 minutes until crispy. Pat dry, then chop finely.
Toss roasted Brussels with balsamic glaze (and bacon if using), then serve and enjoy!

greek_yogurt_parfait.name: Greek Yogurt Parfait
greek_yogurt_parfait.description: A quick and refreshing breakfast or snack with layers of creamy yogurt, crunchy granola, and fresh fruit.
instructions: Prepare fruit by washing and slicing strawberries. Rinse blueberries if needed.
In each serving glass or bowl, spoon 1/4 cup of Greek yogurt into the bottom.
Add a layer of granola (about 2 tablespoons), followed by a layer of mixed fruit.
Repeat layers until the ingredients are used up, ending with fruit on top.
Drizzle honey over the top if desired, and garnish with a mint leaf.
Serve immediately for maximum crunch, or refrigerate for up to 2 hours for a softer texture.

stir_fry_noodles.name: Vegetable Stir Fry with Noodles
stir_fry_noodles.description: A quick and colorful noodle stir fry packed with crisp veggies and a savory-sweet sauce.
ingredients: 8 oz rice noodles or lo mein noodles
instructions: Cook noodles according to package instructions. Drain, rinse with cold water, and set aside.
In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, hoisin, maple syrup, rice vinegar, and chili flakes. Set aside.
Heat sesame oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add garlic and ginger, sauté for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add all vegetables except green onions. Stir-fry for 5-7 minutes until just tender but still crisp.
Add noodles and sauce to the pan. Toss everything together to combine.
If you prefer a thicker sauce, add the cornstarch by making a slurry (starch + 2 tablespoons water) and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes.
Top with sliced green onions and serve hot.

chickpea_salad.name: Mediterranean Chickpea Salad
chickpea_salad.description: A vibrant and protein-rich salad with fresh vegetables, chickpeas, and a zesty lemon-olive oil dressing.
instructions: In a large bowl, combine chickpeas, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, olives, feta, and parsley.
In a small bowl or jar, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Alternativly you can use a bottled dressign of your choice for time and cost reduction.
Pour dressing over the salad and toss gently to coat all ingredients evenly.
Let sit for 10-15 minutes before serving to allow flavors to blend. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

cajun_salmon.name: Cajun Salmon Fillets
cajun_salmon.description: Flavor-packed and perfectly seasoned salmon fillets with a smoky, spicy Cajun kick.
instructions: Preheat a skillet or grill pan over medium-high heat.
Rub salmon fillets with olive oil on both sides.
In a small bowl, mix Cajun seasoning, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper.
Sprinkle the seasoning mixture evenly over both sides of the salmon fillets.
Place salmon fillets in the hot skillet and cook for 4-5 minutes per side, until the salmon is cooked through and has a crispy, golden crust.
Optional: Squeeze fresh lemon juice over the fillets before serving for added brightness.
Recommened side of oven roasted asparapus: oven 375 fahrenheit, oil, salt, and pepper, cook for 30 minutes,

chocolate_mug_cake.name: Chocolate Mug Cake
chocolate_mug_cake.description: A quick and easy single-serve chocolate cake made in the microwave for those chocolate cravings.
instructions: In a microwave-safe mug, whisk together flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt.
Add milk, vegetable oil, and vanilla extract, and stir until smooth and well combined.
Stir in chocolate chips if desired.
Microwave on high for 1 minute and 20 seconds, or until the cake has risen and is set in the middle.
Let cool for a few minutes before serving. Enjoy straight from the mug!

chocolate_truffles.name: Chocolate Truffles
chocolate_truffles.description: Rich, creamy, and indulgent vegan chocolate truffles made with coconut milk and rolled in cocoa powder or chopped nuts.
ingredients: Cocoa powder or chopped nuts for rolling (optional)
instructions: Place dark chocolate chips in a heatproof bowl.
In a small saucepan, heat coconut milk over medium heat until it begins to simmer (but not boil).
Pour hot coconut milk over the chocolate chips and let sit for 2-3 minutes.
Stir until the chocolate is fully melted and smooth. Add vanilla extract and a pinch of salt, and mix to combine.
Refrigerate the chocolate mixture for about 15 minutes to firm up.
Once firm, scoop out small portions and roll them into balls using your hands.
Roll the truffles in cocoa powder or chopped nuts for coating.
Refrigerate the truffles for another 10-15 minutes before serving.

chicken_noodle_soup.name: Chicken Noodle Soup
chicken_noodle_soup.description: A light and comforting chicken noodle soup packed with lean protein and fresh vegetables.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add diced onion, garlic, carrots, and celery. Cook for 5-7 minutes until vegetables are softened.
Pour in chicken broth and bring to a boil.
Add shredded chicken, noodles, thyme, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Reduce heat to a simmer and cook for 10-12 minutes, or until noodles are tender.
Stir in lemon juice and chopped parsley.
Taste and adjust seasoning if needed, then serve warm.

sweet_potato_waffle.name: Savory Sweet Potato Waffles
sweet_potato_waffle.description: Crispy on the outside, soft on the inside—these savory sweet potato waffles are perfect for a unique brunch or light dinner.
ingredients: Olive oil spray or butter for waffle iron
instructions: Preheat your waffle iron according to the manufacturer's instructions and lightly grease.
In a bowl, whisk together mashed sweet potato, eggs, milk, and cheese until smooth.
Add flour, baking powder, garlic powder, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper. Mix until just combined.
Scoop batter into the center of the waffle iron (amount will depend on size of your iron) and close the lid.
Cook for 5-7 minutes, or until waffles are golden and crisp on the edges.
Carefully remove and serve immediately with a dollop of Greek yogurt, avocado, or sautéed greens.

strawberry_banana_smoothie.name: Strawberry Banana Smoothie
strawberry_banana_smoothie.description: A creamy, naturally sweet smoothie perfect for breakfast or a quick snack.
ingredients: 1/2 cup plain Greek yogurt (or dairy-free alternative)
instructions: Add all ingredients to a blender, add less ice then you think you can always add more later.
Blend on high until smooth and creamy.
Taste and adjust sweetness or thickness if desired.
Pour into a glass and serve.

beef_stew.name: Beef Stew
beef_stew.description: A rich, slow-simmered stew packed with tender beef and low-carb veggies—perfect for a comforting keto meal.
ingredients: 1 cup turnips or radishes (peeled and chopped)
1 tablespoon coconut flour (optional, for slight thickening)
instructions: In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat olive oil over medium-high heat.
Sear beef cubes on all sides until browned. Remove and set aside.
In the same pot, sauté onion, garlic, celery, and mushrooms until softened (5-7 minutes).
Add tomato paste, thyme, rosemary, salt, pepper, and stir well.
Return beef to the pot. Add turnips/radishes, bay leaf, and pour in beef broth.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for 1.5-2 hours until beef is fork-tender.
Optional: stir in coconut flour in the last 10 minutes to slightly thicken the broth.
Remove bay leaf before serving. Enjoy warm.

egg_muffins.name: Egg Muffins
egg_muffins.description: Easy low-carb egg muffins packed with protein and veggies—perfect for on-the-go breakfasts.
ingredients: 1/4 cup heavy cream (or unsweetened almond milk)
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Grease a 6-cup muffin tin or use silicone liners.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, cream, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Fold in spinach, bell pepper, onion, cheese, and cooked bacon or sausage.
Pour the mixture evenly into muffin cups (about 3/4 full).
Bake for 18-22 minutes, or until muffins are puffed and set in the center.
Let cool slightly, then remove and enjoy. Store extras in fridge for up to 5 days.

spam_musubi.name: Spam Musubi
spam_musubi.description: A Hawaiian favorite—Spam glazed in a sweet soy sauce, pressed over rice, and wrapped in seaweed. Perfectly portable and super satisfying.
ingredients: 1 can Spam (12 oz, original or low sodium)
2 tablespoons furikake seasoning (optional, for rice seasoning)
4 full sheets of nori (seaweed), cut in half
instructions: Cook rice according to package instructions. Season with furikake seasoning and salt if desired.
Slice Spam into 8 even slices.
In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, sugar, and sesame oil.
In a skillet over medium heat, place spam and pour sauce mixture over.
Fry Spam slices until lightly browned on both sides.
Place a strip of nori shiny-side down. Add a layer of warm rice (using a musubi mold or your hands), pressing gently to form a compact layer.
Top with a slice of glazed Spam, then add another thin layer of rice if preferred.
Wrap nori around the stack and seal by moistening the edge with a bit of water.
Let rest seam-side down for a few minutes before slicing or serving.

salmon_rice_bake.name: Salmon Rice Bake
salmon_rice_bake.description: A comforting baked rice dish layered with flaked salmon, seasoned rice, and a spicy sriracha mayo drizzle.
ingredients: 2 cups cooked jasmine or short-grain rice
1 tablespoon furikake or sesame seeds (for garnish)
Optional: nori strips for topping or serving
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Lightly grease an 8x8-inch baking dish.
In a bowl, season cooked rice with soy sauce, sesame oil, garlic powder, and green onion.
Flake cooked salmon into bite-sized pieces and gently mix into rice.
Spread the salmon rice mixture evenly in the baking dish.
In a small bowl, mix mayo, sriracha, and rice vinegar. Adjust heat level to taste.
Drizzle the sriracha mayo over the rice mixture (or spread evenly if preferred).
Bake uncovered for 15-20 minutes, until warmed through and lightly golden on top.
Top with avocado slices, furikake, and nori if desired. Serve warm!

club_sandwich.name: Classic Club Sandwich
club_sandwich.description: A classic triple-decker sandwich with turkey, bacon, lettuce, tomato, and mayo on toasted bread—perfect for a filling lunch.
ingredients: 3 slices of your favorite bread (can be GF)
2-3 slices of turkey or chicken breast
instructions: Toast 3 slices of bread until golden brown and crispy.
Cook bacon in a skillet over medium heat until crispy. Drain on paper towels.
Spread mayonnaise on two slices of toasted bread. Optionally, add a thin layer of mustard to one slice.
Layer the first slice of bread with turkey slices, followed by a layer of tomato, and some bacon.
Place the second slice of bread on top, then layer with lettuce, more turkey, bacon, and tomato.
Top with the third slice of bread.
Secure the sandwich with toothpicks on all four corners, then cut the sandwich into quarters or halves.

mediterranean_baked_cod.name: Mediterranean Baked Cod with Tomatoes and Olives
mediterranean_baked_cod.description: A light, flavorful fish dish baked with juicy tomatoes, briny olives, and fresh herbs.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Place cod fillets in a baking dish and season with salt and pepper.
Scatter cherry tomatoes, olives, and garlic around the fish.
Drizzle olive oil and lemon juice over the top.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until fish flakes easily with a fork.
Garnish with chopped parsley before serving.

mediterranean_quinoa_bowl.name: Mediterranean Quinoa Bowl with Hummus
mediterranean_quinoa_bowl.description: A wholesome grain bowl with fresh vegetables, creamy hummus, and a lemon-olive oil drizzle.
ingredients: Optional: crumbled feta or chopped parsley
instructions: Rinse quinoa and cook with water or broth according to package directions (about 15 minutes).
Once done, fluff with a fork and divide into serving bowls.
Top each bowl with tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, avocado, and a scoop of hummus.
Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.
Season with salt and pepper, and garnish with parsley or feta if desired.

stuffed_peppers_quinoa.name: Stuffed Bell Peppers with Quinoa and Feta
stuffed_peppers_quinoa.description: Sweet bell peppers roasted and filled with a hearty blend of quinoa, chickpeas, and feta—a balanced, plant-forward main dish.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a bowl, combine quinoa, chickpeas, feta, tomatoes, parsley, olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Spoon the mixture into the halved bell peppers.
Place peppers in a baking dish and cover loosely with foil.
Bake for 30-35 minutes until the peppers are tender.
Uncover and bake for an additional 5-10 minutes to brown the tops.
Serve warm.

shakshuka.name: Shakshuka (Poached Eggs in Tomato Sauce)
shakshuka.description: A cozy North African-inspired dish with eggs simmered in a spiced tomato and bell pepper sauce. Ideal for any meal of the day.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Sauté onion and bell pepper until soft.
Add garlic, paprika, cumin, and chili flakes. Cook for 1 minute.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 10 minutes to thicken.
Make 4 small wells in the sauce and crack an egg into each well.
Cover the skillet and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until the eggs are set to your liking.
Garnish with fresh herbs and serve with crusty bread or pita.

grilled_eggplant_yogurt.name: Grilled Eggplant with Herbed Yogurt Sauce
grilled_eggplant_yogurt.description: Smoky grilled eggplant slices served with a creamy Greek yogurt sauce—perfect as a side, starter, or light main.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons chopped fresh dill or mint
instructions: Brush eggplant slices with olive oil and season with salt.
Grill or pan-sear over medium-high heat for 3-4 minutes per side, until tender and lightly charred.
In a small bowl, mix Greek yogurt, garlic, lemon juice, herbs, salt, and pepper.
Serve the grilled eggplant warm or at room temperature with a dollop of herbed yogurt sauce.

lemon_herb_chicken_farro.name: Lemon Herb Chicken with Farro Salad
lemon_herb_chicken_farro.description: Juicy, marinated chicken thighs served over a hearty farro salad with cucumbers, cherry tomatoes, and fresh herbs.
instructions: In a bowl, mix lemon juice, zest, olive oil, garlic, oregano, salt, and pepper. Marinate chicken for at least 20 minutes.
Cook farro in water or broth according to package instructions (about 25 minutes). Drain and let cool.
Grill or pan-sear chicken on medium heat for 6-7 minutes per side, until fully cooked.
In a large bowl, combine farro, cucumber, tomatoes, parsley, vinegar, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Slice chicken and serve over the farro salad.

tuna_whitebean_pita.name: Tuna and White Bean Salad with Pita
tuna_whitebean_pita.description: A simple, high-protein salad featuring tuna, creamy white beans, crisp veggies, and warm pita for scooping.
ingredients: 1 (15 oz) can white beans (drained and rinsed)
instructions: In a bowl, combine tuna, white beans, onion, cucumber, capers, parsley, lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Gently toss to combine, being careful not to mash the beans too much.
Warm pita in a dry skillet or toaster.
Serve the salad with pita on the side for scooping or wrapping.

lamb_kofta_yogurt.name: Lamb Kofta with Yogurt-Tahini Sauce
lamb_kofta_yogurt.description: Middle Eastern spiced lamb kofta grilled and served with a creamy yogurt-tahini sauce and cucumber salad.
instructions: In a bowl, combine lamb, garlic, onion, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, salt, and pepper.
Form into 8-10 small patties or oval-shaped kofta and chill for 10 minutes.
Grill or pan-sear over medium-high heat for about 4-5 minutes per side until browned and cooked through.
For the sauce, whisk together yogurt, tahini, lemon juice, garlic, and salt until smooth.
Serve kofta with yogurt sauce and optional cucumber salad or flatbread.

garlic_shrimp_pasta.name: Garlic Shrimp Pasta with Spinach and Sun-Dried Tomatoes
garlic_shrimp_pasta.description: A light and zesty Mediterranean pasta tossed with garlicky shrimp, baby spinach, and sun-dried tomatoes in olive oil.
instructions: Cook pasta according to package instructions. Reserve 1/2 cup pasta water and drain the rest.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic and red pepper flakes; cook for 30 seconds.
Add shrimp and cook for 2-3 minutes per side until pink. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, add sun-dried tomatoes and spinach. Cook until spinach wilts.
Add cooked pasta, shrimp, lemon juice, and reserved pasta water as needed.
Toss everything to coat evenly and season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with parsley and serve warm.

moroccan_couscous_veggies.name: Moroccan Couscous with Roasted Vegetables
moroccan_couscous_veggies.description: Warm, fluffy couscous topped with a rainbow of spiced roasted veggies, chickpeas, and a drizzle of lemon dressing.
ingredients: 1 1/4 cups boiling water or vegetable broth
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Toss chopped vegetables and chickpeas with olive oil, cumin, cinnamon, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes until tender and slightly charred.
In a bowl, pour boiling water or broth over couscous. Cover and let sit for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork.
Top couscous with roasted vegetables, squeeze lemon juice on top, and sprinkle with parsley.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

bulgur_tabbouleh_chicken.name: Bulgur Tabbouleh with Grilled Chicken
bulgur_tabbouleh_chicken.description: A refreshing take on tabbouleh, served as a full meal with grilled lemon herb chicken over herby bulgur.
instructions: Place bulgur in a large bowl and cover with boiling water. Cover and let sit for 15-20 minutes, then fluff.
In a small bowl, mix lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper to dress the tabbouleh.
Add cucumber, tomatoes, onion, parsley, and mint to the bulgur. Pour dressing over and mix well.
Season chicken with oregano, garlic, salt, pepper, and olive oil.
Grill or pan-sear chicken on medium-high heat for 5-6 minutes per side, until fully cooked.
Slice chicken and serve over tabbouleh salad.

banana_oat_muffins.name: Banana Oat Muffins
banana_oat_muffins.description: Wholesome banana oat muffins with no refined sugar—great for breakfast or healthy snacking.
ingredients: 1/3 cup mini chocolate chips or chopped nuts (optional)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease or line a muffin tin.
In a bowl, mash bananas and mix with eggs, syrup, oil, vanilla, and almond milk.
Stir in oats, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt until combined.
Fold in chocolate chips or nuts if using.
Divide batter evenly into muffin cups and bake for 18-22 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Cool before serving. Store in an airtight container.

breakfast_burrito.name: Breakfast Burrito
breakfast_burrito.description: A protein-packed breakfast burrito filled with scrambled eggs, veggies, and black beans wrapped in a whole wheat tortilla.
ingredients: 1/2 cup canned black beans (drained and rinsed)
1/3 cup shredded cheddar or Mexican blend cheese
Optional: salsa, avocado, hot sauce for serving
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, salt, and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add bell peppers and onion, cook until softened (3–4 min).
Add black beans and cook for another 2 minutes.
Pour in egg mixture and scramble until fully cooked.
Warm tortillas and divide the egg mixture evenly among them.
Top with cheese and optional toppings like salsa or avocado.
Fold into burritos and serve warm or wrap for later.

mediterranean_breakfast_bowl.name: Mediterranean Breakfast Bowl
mediterranean_breakfast_bowl.description: A refreshing and wholesome Mediterranean breakfast bowl with eggs, hummus, fresh veggies, and whole grains.
ingredients: Fresh parsley or dill for garnish
Optional: Kalamata olives, crumbled feta cheese, lemon wedge
instructions: Cook the quinoa or farro according to package instructions if not pre-cooked.
In a skillet, fry or poach the eggs to your desired doneness.
In each bowl, layer the grains, avocado, tomatoes, cucumber, and egg.
Add a dollop of hummus and drizzle with olive oil.
Season with salt, pepper, and garnish with herbs.
Add optional toppings like olives, feta, or a squeeze of lemon. Serve immediately.

breakfast_hash.name: Breakfast Hash
breakfast_hash.description: A hearty and healthy breakfast hash with sweet potatoes, eggs, spinach, and avocado.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Add diced sweet potatoes and cook for 10 minutes or until tender.
Add bell peppers, onion, and paprika. Cook for 5-7 minutes until veggies are softened.
Stir in spinach and cook until wilted.
In a separate pan, cook eggs to your liking (fried or scrambled).
Top hash with eggs and sliced avocado. Season with salt and pepper.

coconut_lime_shrimp.name: Coconut Lime Shrimp
coconut_lime_shrimp.description: Juicy shrimp simmered in creamy coconut milk with zesty lime and chili flakes.
instructions: Heat coconut oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Add garlic and red pepper flakes; sauté for 1 minute.
Add shrimp and cook until pink, about 5-8 minutes total.
Pour in coconut milk, lime juice, and zest. Stir to coat.
Simmer for 2 more minutes until heated through.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot.

turkey_avocado_wrap.name: Turkey Avocado Lettuce Wraps
turkey_avocado_wrap.description: A low-carb, high-protein lunch made with lean turkey, creamy avocado, and fresh veggies wrapped in crisp lettuce leaves.
ingredients: 6 large romaine or butter lettuce leaves
instructions: Lay the lettuce leaves flat and pat dry if needed.
Spread a small amount of mustard on each leaf.
Layer turkey, avocado, tomato, and onion on top.
Season with salt and pepper.
Roll or fold into wraps and serve immediately.

grilled_chicken_hummus_bowl.name: Grilled Chicken & Hummus Bowl
grilled_chicken_hummus_bowl.description: A balanced Mediterranean-style bowl featuring juicy grilled chicken, creamy hummus, and fresh veggies over greens or grains.
ingredients: 1 cup cooked quinoa or brown rice
instructions: Divide greens into two bowls.
Top with chicken, quinoa or rice, veggies, olives, and feta.
Add a scoop of hummus to each bowl.
Drizzle with lemon juice and olive oil.
Season with salt and pepper and serve.

zucchini_pesto_noodles.name: Zucchini Noodles with Pesto & Cherry Tomatoes
zucchini_pesto_noodles.description: A light and refreshing low-carb dish featuring spiralized zucchini tossed with pesto and juicy cherry tomatoes.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Add zucchini noodles and cook for 2-3 minutes until slightly softened.
Stir in pesto and cherry tomatoes. Cook 1-2 more minutes.
Add grilled protein if using, and toss everything together.
Season with salt and pepper and serve warm or cold.

chia_pudding.name: Vanilla Chia Pudding
chia_pudding.description: A creamy and nutrient-rich snack packed with fiber, omega-3s, and natural sweetness.
ingredients: Optional toppings: berries, granola, coconut flakes
instructions: In a bowl or jar, mix chia seeds, almond milk, vanilla, and sweetener.
Stir well, then refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Stir again before serving and add toppings as desired.

apple_peanut_bites.name: Apple Peanut Butter Bites
apple_peanut_bites.description: Crisp apple slices paired with creamy peanut butter and toppings for a satisfying and energizing snack.
ingredients: Optional: drizzle of honey or sprinkle of cinnamon
instructions: Spread peanut butter over apple slices.
Sprinkle with granola, nuts, or cinnamon.
Serve immediately as a quick snack.

roasted_chickpeas.name: Crispy Roasted Chickpeas
roasted_chickpeas.description: A crunchy, high-protein snack that's perfect for munching and easy to season your way.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Pat chickpeas dry and toss with oil and seasonings.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 30-35 minutes until crispy.
Cool before serving or storing.

edamame.name: Edamame
edamame.description: A simple and satisfying snack, edamame beans are packed with protein and served with a pinch of sea salt.
ingredients: 2 cups edamame (in pods, frozen or fresh)
instructions: Boil or steam edamame pods for 3-5 minutes until tender.
Drain and sprinkle with sea salt and chili flakes (or sesame seeds if desired).
Serve warm or chilled.

rice_paper_rolls.name: Fresh Rice Paper Rolls
rice_paper_rolls.description: These fresh, crunchy rice paper rolls are filled with vegetables and shrimp, served with a tangy dipping sauce.
instructions: Soak rice paper wrappers in warm water until soft.
Place shrimp, cucumber, carrots, cilantro, and lettuce in the center of the wrapper.
Roll tightly, folding in the sides as you go.
For the dipping sauce, mix rice vinegar, soy sauce, honey, and chili sauce (optional).
Serve rolls with dipping sauce.

veggie_chips_with_guacamole.name: Veggie Chips with Guacamole
veggie_chips_with_guacamole.description: A creamy, flavorful guacamole served with crispy, homemade veggie chips for a healthy, satisfying snack.
ingredients: 2 cups assorted vegetable chips (or homemade baked tortilla chips)
instructions: In a bowl, mash the avocados.
Add onion, tomato, garlic, lime juice, and cilantro.
Season with salt and pepper, then stir to combine.
Serve guacamole with veggie chips or homemade tortilla chips.

mini_quesadillas.name: Mini Quesadillas
mini_quesadillas.description: Quick and easy mini quesadillas made with whole wheat tortillas, cheese, and a sprinkle of spices.
ingredients: 1/2 cup shredded cheese (cheddar, mozzarella, or Mexican blend)
instructions: Heat a skillet over medium heat and lightly grease with olive oil.
Place a tortilla in the skillet, sprinkle with cheese, and top with another tortilla.
Cook until golden and crispy, flipping halfway through.
Cut into wedges and serve with salsa or guacamole.

mexican_street_corn_bites.name: Mexican Street Corn Bites
mexican_street_corn_bites.description: Mini corn bites inspired by Mexican street corn, topped with cheese, cilantro, and a squeeze of lime.
ingredients: 4 mini corn cobs (or 2 medium-sized corn on the cob)
instructions: Grill or boil the corn until tender, about 7-12 minutes.
Cut the corn into bite-sized pieces.
Sprinkle the corn with cotija cheese, cilantro, chili powder, paprika, and salt.
Serve with lime wedges.

lemon_herb_couscous.name: Lemon-Herb Couscous with Olives and Tomatoes
lemon_herb_couscous.description: A bright, fluffy couscous dish with cherry tomatoes, kalamata olives, and fresh herbs.
ingredients: 1 cup boiling water or vegetable broth
instructions: Place couscous in a bowl, pour boiling broth over it, cover and let sit for 5 minutes.
Fluff with a fork and stir in olive oil, lemon juice, tomatoes, olives, and parsley.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve warm or at room temperature.

garlic_roasted_broccoli.name: Garlic Roasted Broccoli with Lemon Zest
garlic_roasted_broccoli.description: Crispy oven-roasted broccoli tossed in olive oil, garlic, and fresh lemon zest.
ingredients: 1 large head of broccoli (cut into florets)
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F.
Toss broccoli with olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper. Spread on a baking sheet.
Roast for 18-22 minutes until crisp and golden.
Sprinkle with lemon zest before serving.

caprese_skewers.name: Caprese Skewers with Basil Balsamic Drizzle
caprese_skewers.description: Fresh mozzarella, basil, and tomatoes on skewers, finished with balsamic reduction.
instructions: Alternate tomato, basil, and mozzarella on each skewer.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze and season with salt and pepper.
Serve chilled or room temp.

zucchini_fries.name: Zucchini Fries with Garlic Aioli
zucchini_fries.description: Baked zucchini fries with a crispy almond flour coating and a creamy garlic aioli dip.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment.
Dip zucchini sticks in egg, then coat with almond flour mixture.
Bake 20-25 minutes until golden and crisp.
Mix mayo, garlic, and lemon for aioli. Serve with fries.

cauliflower_mash.name: Cauliflower Mash with Olive Oil and Garlic
cauliflower_mash.description: A creamy and savory mashed cauliflower dish perfect as a low-carb paleo alternative to mashed potatoes.
instructions: Steam cauliflower until tender (10-12 minutes).
In a skillet, lightly sauté garlic in olive oil.
Blend cauliflower, garlic, oil, salt, and pepper until smooth.
Garnish with chopped chives and serve warm.

cucumber_dill_salad.name: Cucumber Dill Salad with Red Onion
cucumber_dill_salad.description: A crisp, refreshing salad with sliced cucumber, red onion, and a Whole30-friendly vinegar dressing.
instructions: Toss cucumber and onion in a bowl.
In a separate bowl, whisk vinegar, olive oil, dill, salt, and pepper.
Pour dressing over salad, toss, and let chill 10 minutes before serving.

roasted_red_pepper_hummus.name: Roasted Red Pepper Hummus
roasted_red_pepper_hummus.description: Creamy, smoky hummus made with roasted red peppers and tahini. Perfect as a dip or side spread.
ingredients: 1 roasted red bell pepper (jarred or homemade)
instructions: Add all ingredients to a food processor and blend until smooth.
Adjust seasoning as needed. Add water to thin if necessary.
Serve chilled or room temp with pita or veggies.

charred_asparagus_lemon.name: Charred Asparagus with Lemon Zest
charred_asparagus_lemon.description: Tender asparagus charred in a skillet and finished with lemon zest and olive oil.
instructions: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add asparagus and cook 5-7 minutes, flipping occasionally until slightly charred.
Season with salt, pepper, and lemon zest. Serve warm.

avocado_tomato_salad.name: Avocado Tomato Salad
avocado_tomato_salad.description: A quick salad with creamy avocado, juicy tomatoes, and a light olive oil dressing.
instructions: Combine avocado and tomatoes in a bowl.
Drizzle with olive oil and vinegar.
Toss gently and season with salt and pepper.

parmesan_cauliflower_bites.name: Crispy Parmesan Cauliflower Bites
parmesan_cauliflower_bites.description: Roasted cauliflower coated in herbs and parmesan for a low-carb, keto-friendly crunch.
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F.
Toss cauliflower with oil and seasonings, then coat with parmesan.
Roast on a baking sheet for 20-25 minutes, flipping once.
Serve hot as a crispy side.

roasted_beets_carrots.name: Roasted Beets and Carrots
roasted_beets_carrots.description: Earthy beets and sweet carrots roasted to bring out their natural flavors.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Toss beets and carrots with olive oil, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Roast for 30-40 minutes until tender and slightly caramelized.
Serve warm.

garlic_green_beans.name: Sautéed Garlic Green Beans
garlic_green_beans.description: Simple green beans sautéed in olive oil and garlic — a fast Whole30-friendly side dish.
instructions: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Add garlic and cook 30 seconds. Add green beans and sauté for 5-8 minutes until tender-crisp.
Season and serve.

mediterranean_orzo_salad.name: Mediterranean Orzo Salad
mediterranean_orzo_salad.description: A light and flavorful pasta salad with orzo, tomatoes, feta, and olives in a lemon vinaigrette.
instructions: Cook orzo according to package instructions. Drain and let cool.
Combine orzo, tomatoes, olives, feta, and parsley in a bowl.
Whisk together olive oil, vinegar, lemon zest, salt, and pepper. Pour over salad and toss.
Chill for 15 minutes before serving.

bulgur_herb_pilaf.name: Bulgur Wheat Pilaf with Herbs
bulgur_herb_pilaf.description: A warm, nutty bulgur side dish tossed with fresh herbs and olive oil.
instructions: In a saucepan, bring broth to a boil. Stir in bulgur, cover, and remove from heat. Let sit for 15 minutes.
Fluff bulgur with a fork, stir in olive oil, garlic, parsley, salt, and pepper.
Serve warm or room temperature.

whole_wheat_panzanella.name: Whole Wheat Panzanella
whole_wheat_panzanella.description: A rustic Italian bread salad made with toasted whole wheat bread, tomatoes, and cucumbers.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F. Toast bread cubes for 10-12 minutes until crisp.
Combine bread, tomatoes, cucumber, and onion in a bowl.
Whisk oil, vinegar, garlic, salt, and pepper. Pour over salad and toss well.
Let sit for 10-15 minutes to soak up flavor, then serve.

creamy_macaroni_side_bake.name: Creamy Macaroni Side Bake
creamy_macaroni_side_bake.description: A comforting, cheesy baked macaroni casserole served as a hearty side dish.
instructions: Cook macaroni to al dente. Drain and set aside.
In a saucepan, melt butter and whisk in flour. Cook 1 minute.
Slowly whisk in milk and cook until thickened.
Stir in cheese, paprika, salt, and pepper until melted.
Combine with pasta, pour into a baking dish, and bake at 375°F for 15-20 min until bubbly.

garlic_herb_bread.name: Garlic Bread with Olive Oil and Herbs
garlic_herb_bread.description: Crispy slices of bread toasted with olive oil, garlic, and herbs — a savory, simple side.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Mix olive oil, garlic, oregano, basil, and salt.
Brush on bread slices and toast for 8-10 minutes until golden.
Serve warm.

couscous_pine_nuts.name: Couscous with Toasted Pine Nuts
couscous_pine_nuts.description: Light and fluffy couscous side dish tossed with olive oil and toasted pine nuts.
instructions: Toast pine nuts in a dry skillet until golden and fragrant.
Bring water or broth to a boil, stir in couscous, cover and remove from heat. Let sit for 5 minutes.
Fluff with a fork, add olive oil, pine nuts, and parsley. Season and serve.

fried_rice_scallions.name: Fried Rice with Soy Sauce and Scallions
fried_rice_scallions.description: Simple and satisfying fried rice tossed with scallions and savory soy sauce.
instructions: Heat sesame oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Add rice and stir-fry 3-5 minutes. Push rice to the side, scramble egg if using, then combine.
Stir in soy sauce and green onions. Season and serve.

cheesy_polenta.name: Cheesy Polenta with Butter
cheesy_polenta.description: Creamy cooked polenta stirred with butter and cheese — a rich and comforting side dish.
instructions: Bring liquid to a boil. Slowly whisk in polenta, reduce heat to low.
Cook, stirring frequently, until thick and creamy (15-20 minutes).
Stir in butter and cheese. Season and serve warm.

ricotta_toast_honey.name: Ricotta Toast with Honey and Pistachios
ricotta_toast_honey.description: Creamy ricotta cheese spread over toasted bread, topped with sweet honey and crunchy pistachios — a light and elegant Italian breakfast.
instructions: Toast the bread slices until golden and crispy.
Spread a generous layer of ricotta cheese over each slice.
Drizzle honey evenly over the top.
Sprinkle with chopped pistachios and optional lemon zest.
Serve immediately while the toast is still warm.

congee_rice_porridge.name: Congee (Rice Porridge)
congee_rice_porridge.description: A warm, comforting rice porridge often enjoyed for breakfast across Asia, topped with savory garnishes like scallions and soy sauce.
ingredients: Optional toppings: sliced scallions, soy sauce, sesame oil, shredded chicken, boiled egg, fried shallots
instructions: In a large pot, combine rice, water or broth, and salt.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer uncovered.
Stir occasionally and simmer for 50-60 minutes until rice breaks down and porridge thickens.
Add extra water if needed for a thinner consistency.
Serve hot with your choice of toppings.

hawaiian_loco_moco.name: Hawaiian Loco Moco
hawaiian_loco_moco.description: A traditional Hawaiian breakfast featuring a juicy hamburger patty served over rice, topped with rich brown gravy and a fried egg.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon cornstarch mixed with 2 tablespoons water
instructions: Cook hamburger patties in a skillet over medium heat until fully cooked. Set aside.
In the same skillet, add beef broth and soy sauce. Bring to a simmer.
Stir in the cornstarch slurry and cook until gravy thickens.
In a separate pan, fry eggs to your liking (sunny-side up recommended).
To assemble: place rice on the plate, top with a burger patty, ladle gravy over, and crown with a fried egg.
Serve immediately.

berry_almond_oatmeal_bake.name: Berry Almond Oatmeal Bake
berry_almond_oatmeal_bake.description: A wholesome baked oatmeal filled with fresh berries and sliced almonds, Mediterranean-style with olive oil.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F. Lightly grease a baking dish.
Mix oats, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt in a bowl.
In another bowl, whisk almond milk, olive oil, and honey.
Combine wet and dry ingredients, fold in berries and almonds.
Bake for 30-35 minutes until golden.

sweet_potato_breakfast_hash.name: Sweet Potato Breakfast Hash
sweet_potato_breakfast_hash.description: A hearty and colorful vegan breakfast hash made with sweet potatoes, peppers, and onions.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Cook sweet potatoes for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add peppers, onion, and paprika. Cook for another 8–10 minutes until tender.
Season with salt and pepper and serve hot.

tomato_basil_bruschetta.name: Tomato Basil Bruschetta
tomato_basil_bruschetta.description: Classic Italian toasted bread topped with juicy tomatoes, fresh basil, and olive oil — perfect for a Mediterranean breakfast or snack.
instructions: Toast bread slices until golden and crispy.
Rub toasted bread with garlic clove for flavor.
In a bowl, mix tomatoes, basil, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Spoon tomato mixture over bread and serve immediately.

vegan_lemon_almond_biscotti.name: Vegan Lemon Almond Biscotti
vegan_lemon_almond_biscotti.description: Crunchy, zesty biscotti made without dairy or eggs — perfect with a morning espresso.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Mix dry ingredients in one bowl; wet ingredients in another.
Combine and form a dough, fold in almonds.
Shape into a log and bake for 25 minutes. Cool slightly.
Slice and bake slices another 10-15 minutes until crisp.

polenta_breakfast_porridge.name: Polenta Breakfast Porridge
polenta_breakfast_porridge.description: Creamy gluten-free polenta cooked into a slightly sweet breakfast porridge topped with fruit and honey.
instructions: Bring water to a boil. Whisk in polenta slowly.
Simmer and stir until thickened, about 15–20 minutes.
Stir in honey and vanilla.
Top with fresh berries and nuts before serving.

prosciutto_asparagus_egg.name: Prosciutto-Wrapped Asparagus with Egg
prosciutto_asparagus_egg.description: Savory prosciutto-wrapped asparagus baked and served with a fried egg — a low-carb Italian breakfast treat.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Wrap asparagus spears with prosciutto.
Bake for 10-12 minutes until crispy.
Meanwhile, fry eggs in olive oil.
Serve asparagus with a fried egg on top.

eggplant_tomato_breakfast_stack.name: Eggplant and Tomato Breakfast Stack
eggplant_tomato_breakfast_stack.description: Seared slices of eggplant stacked with juicy tomatoes and fresh basil — a light and savory Paleo breakfast option.
instructions: Brush eggplant slices with olive oil, season with salt and pepper.
Pan-sear over medium heat until golden brown and tender.
Layer eggplant and tomato slices, garnish with basil.
Serve warm or room temperature.

italian_breakfast_salad.name: Italian Breakfast Salad
italian_breakfast_salad.description: A fresh Whole30 Italian breakfast salad with mixed greens, soft-boiled eggs, olives, and a lemon olive oil dressing.
instructions: Arrange greens, cucumber, and olives in bowls.
Top each with a halved soft-boiled egg.
Whisk olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper for dressing.
Drizzle dressing over and serve.

italian_lemon_ricotta_pancakes.name: Italian Lemon Ricotta Pancakes
italian_lemon_ricotta_pancakes.description: Fluffy, lightly sweet pancakes made with ricotta cheese and fresh lemon zest — a traditional Italian-inspired vegetarian breakfast.
ingredients: Optional: powdered sugar or fresh berries for topping
instructions: In a bowl, mix flour, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk ricotta, milk, egg yolks, sugar, and lemon zest.
Gently fold dry ingredients into wet ingredients.
In a clean bowl, beat egg whites to soft peaks and fold into batter.
Heat a skillet over medium heat with butter or oil.
Spoon batter onto skillet and cook until bubbles form, then flip and cook until golden.
Serve with optional powdered sugar or fresh berries.

avocado_black_bean_breakfast_tacos.name: Avocado and Black Bean Breakfast Tacos
avocado_black_bean_breakfast_tacos.description: Fresh breakfast tacos filled with creamy avocado, seasoned black beans, and a sprinkle of queso fresco — Mediterranean and Mexican fusion.
ingredients: 1 cup canned black beans (rinsed and drained)
instructions: Warm tortillas in a skillet.
Mash or lightly sauté black beans with salt, pepper, and lime juice.
Assemble tacos with black beans, avocado slices, tomatoes, and cilantro.
Top with queso fresco if desired and serve immediately.

vegan_breakfast_chilaquiles.name: Vegan Breakfast Chilaquiles
vegan_breakfast_chilaquiles.description: Crispy tortilla chips tossed in a smoky red salsa and topped with avocado, fresh herbs, and radishes — a flavorful vegan Mexican breakfast.
instructions: Fry tortilla triangles in oil until crispy, then drain on paper towels.
In a skillet, heat salsa and toss chips to coat.
Top with avocado, cilantro, and radishes before serving.

huevos_rancheros.name: Huevos Rancheros
huevos_rancheros.description: A classic gluten-free Mexican breakfast with crispy tortillas, fried eggs, and a zesty tomato-chili sauce.
ingredients: Optional: fresh cilantro and avocado for topping
instructions: In a pan, sauté onions, garlic, and jalapeño until soft.
Add tomatoes and simmer for 5 minutes.
Fry tortillas until crispy, and fry eggs separately.
Top tortillas with eggs and pour sauce over.
Garnish with cilantro and avocado if desired.

keto_mexican_breakfast_bowl.name: Keto Mexican Breakfast Bowl
keto_mexican_breakfast_bowl.description: A low-carb breakfast bowl with scrambled eggs, avocado, salsa, and sautéed peppers — bursting with Mexican flavors.
instructions: Scramble eggs with salt and pepper in olive oil.
In bowls, layer eggs, avocado slices, sautéed peppers, and salsa.
Serve hot.

paleo_mexican_scramble.name: Paleo Mexican Scramble
paleo_mexican_scramble.description: Eggs scrambled with sautéed onions, peppers, and cilantro for a simple Paleo-friendly Mexican breakfast.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a skillet.
Sauté peppers and onions until soft.
Add eggs and scramble gently.
Stir in cilantro before serving.

whole30_avocado_egg_boats.name: Avocado Egg Boats
whole30_avocado_egg_boats.description: Baked avocados filled with eggs and salsa — a quick and satisfying Whole30-compliant Mexican breakfast.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Scoop out a little extra avocado to make room for eggs.
Crack an egg into each avocado half.
Bake for 12-15 minutes until eggs are set.
Top with salsa and cilantro.

asian_tomato_egg_stirfry.name: Asian Tomato and Egg Stir-Fry
asian_tomato_egg_stirfry.description: A classic Chinese-style Mediterranean fusion dish with fluffy scrambled eggs and sweet tomatoes, perfect for a light breakfast.
instructions: Whisk eggs with a pinch of salt.
Heat olive oil in a skillet, scramble eggs until just set, then remove.
Add tomatoes, sugar, and a pinch of salt to the skillet. Cook until juicy.
Return eggs to pan, gently mix, and garnish with green onion.

vegan_rice_congee.name: Vegan Rice Congee
vegan_rice_congee.description: A soothing, warm rice porridge made with vegetable broth — a traditional vegan Asian breakfast comfort food.
ingredients: Toppings: scallions, sesame seeds, soy sauce
instructions: Rinse rice and add to a large pot with broth and ginger.
Bring to a boil, then simmer uncovered for 45-60 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Season with salt and serve with desired toppings.

miso_soup_with_rice.name: Miso Soup with Rice
miso_soup_with_rice.description: Traditional Japanese miso soup served with steamed rice — a naturally gluten-free and nourishing breakfast.
instructions: Bring water to a simmer. Stir in miso paste until dissolved.
Add tofu cubes and nori pieces. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve soup hot with cooked rice on the side or in the bowl.

keto_egg_roll_in_a_bowl.name: Keto Egg Roll in a Bowl
keto_egg_roll_in_a_bowl.description: All the flavors of an Asian egg roll but without the wrapper — perfect for a keto-friendly breakfast.
instructions: Brown pork in a skillet over medium heat.
Add shredded cabbage, soy sauce, sesame oil, and stir-fry until tender.
Top with green onions and serve warm.

paleo_breakfast_stirfry.name: Paleo Breakfast Stir-Fry
paleo_breakfast_stirfry.description: Quick Asian stir-fried vegetables and eggs — a colorful and healthy paleo breakfast option.
instructions: Heat coconut oil in a wok.
Add veggies and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes.
Push veggies to one side and scramble eggs on the other side.
Mix everything together with coconut aminos and serve.

whole30_asian_breakfast_salad.name: Asian Breakfast Salad
whole30_asian_breakfast_salad.description: A refreshing breakfast salad with mixed greens, cucumber, avocado, and a sesame-ginger dressing — Whole30-approved.
instructions: In a bowl, combine greens, cucumber, and avocado.
Whisk olive oil, sesame oil, ginger, lime juice, salt, and pepper.
Drizzle dressing over salad and serve.

scallion_rice_cakes.name: Scallion Rice Cakes
scallion_rice_cakes.description: Crispy pan-fried rice cakes with scallions — a simple and hearty vegetarian Asian breakfast treat.
instructions: Mix cooked rice, flour, green onions, salt, and pepper into a sticky dough.
Form small patties and pan-fry in sesame oil until golden and crispy on both sides.
Serve warm.

mediterranean_egg_scramble.name: Mediterranean Egg Scramble
mediterranean_egg_scramble.description: Fluffy scrambled eggs cooked with spinach, sun-dried tomatoes, and feta cheese — a quick and flavorful Mediterranean breakfast.
instructions: In a bowl, whisk eggs with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add spinach and sun-dried tomatoes; sauté until spinach wilts.
Pour in eggs and scramble gently.
Sprinkle feta on top before serving.

vegan_mediterranean_breakfast_wrap.name: Vegan Mediterranean Breakfast Wrap
vegan_mediterranean_breakfast_wrap.description: A hearty vegan wrap stuffed with hummus, cucumber, tomatoes, and spinach for a light and refreshing Mediterranean breakfast.
instructions: Spread hummus onto each tortilla.
Layer cucumber, tomatoes, and spinach evenly.
Drizzle with olive oil and season lightly with salt and pepper.
Roll up tightly and serve.

keto_mediterranean_omelette.name: Keto Mediterranean Omelette
keto_mediterranean_omelette.description: A low-carb omelette packed with olives, spinach, and feta — a classic Mediterranean start to the day.
instructions: Whisk eggs with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a non-stick skillet.
Add spinach and olives, sauté briefly, then pour in eggs.
Cook until set, sprinkle feta on top, fold and serve.

paleo_breakfast_mezze_plate.name: Paleo Breakfast Mezze Plate
paleo_breakfast_mezze_plate.description: A simple Paleo breakfast platter with boiled eggs, olives, cucumber, and a drizzle of olive oil — inspired by a classic Mediterranean mezze spread.
instructions: Arrange boiled eggs, cucumber slices, tomatoes, and olives on a plate.
Drizzle with olive oil and season lightly with salt and pepper.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.

whole30_cucumber_avocado_salad.name: Cucumber Avocado Salad
whole30_cucumber_avocado_salad.description: A crisp Mediterranean-inspired salad with cucumber, creamy avocado, and fresh lemon — Whole30-approved and perfect for breakfast.
instructions: In a bowl, combine cucumber, avocado, and parsley.
Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.
Toss gently and season with salt and pepper before serving.

mediterranean_loco_moco.name: Mediterranean-Inspired Loco Moco
mediterranean_loco_moco.description: A lighter, Mediterranean take on the classic Hawaiian loco moco with lean turkey patties, brown rice, and a herbed tomato sauce.
instructions: Form ground turkey into two patties. Season with salt and pepper.
Cook patties in olive oil until browned and cooked through.
Warm tomato sauce with oregano and season lightly.
Fry eggs to desired doneness.
To serve: plate brown rice, top with turkey patty, tomato sauce, and fried egg.

vegan_haupia_chia_pudding.name: Vegan Coconut Haupia Chia Pudding
vegan_haupia_chia_pudding.description: A tropical twist on chia pudding, infused with creamy coconut milk and sweetened naturally — inspired by traditional Hawaiian haupia.
ingredients: Fresh pineapple or mango for topping
instructions: In a bowl, combine chia seeds, coconut milk, maple syrup, and vanilla.
Mix well and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Top with diced fresh fruit before serving.

glutenfree_pineapple_fried_rice.name: Gluten-Free Pineapple Fried Rice
glutenfree_pineapple_fried_rice.description: A sweet and savory fried rice with pineapple chunks, veggies, and gluten-free tamari — a classic Hawaiian flavor combo.
ingredients: 2 cups cooked jasmine rice (day old preferred)
instructions: Heat coconut oil in a wok or skillet.
Add pineapple and peppers, stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Add rice and tamari. Stir-fry for another 3–5 minutes.
Top with green onions and serve.

keto_hawaiian_breakfast_skillet.name: Keto Hawaiian Breakfast Skillet
keto_hawaiian_breakfast_skillet.description: A hearty low-carb Hawaiian-style skillet with ham, eggs, and sautéed spinach for a keto-friendly island breakfast.
instructions: Heat butter or coconut oil in a skillet.
Add ham and cook until browned.
Add spinach and stir until wilted.
Push to the side and crack in eggs; cook to desired doneness.
Serve immediately.

paleo_kalua_pork_eggs.name: Paleo Kalua Pork and Eggs
paleo_kalua_pork_eggs.description: Tender shredded kalua pork served with sunny-side-up eggs — a traditional Hawaiian breakfast made paleo-friendly.
instructions: Warm kalua pork in a skillet over medium heat.
In a separate skillet, fry eggs in coconut oil until edges are crispy.
Plate pork and top with eggs.
Garnish with green onions if desired.

whole30_tropical_breakfast_bowl.name: Tropical Breakfast Bowl
whole30_tropical_breakfast_bowl.description: A refreshing tropical bowl with fresh mango, banana, and coconut flakes — all Whole30 compliant and naturally sweet.
instructions: Arrange mango, banana, and coconut flakes in a bowl.
Drizzle with lime juice.
Sprinkle with macadamia nuts before serving.

pineapple_cottage_cheese_bowl.name: Pineapple Cottage Cheese Bowl
pineapple_cottage_cheese_bowl.description: A sweet and savory breakfast bowl pairing creamy cottage cheese with juicy pineapple chunks for a simple Hawaiian-inspired start.
instructions: Scoop cottage cheese into a bowl.
Top with diced pineapple and macadamia nuts.
Sprinkle cinnamon if desired and serve.

mediterranean_chicken_salad_wrap.name: Mediterranean Chicken Salad Wrap
mediterranean_chicken_salad_wrap.description: Tender chicken salad with olives, cucumbers, and feta wrapped in soft flatbread for a Mediterranean-style lunch.
instructions: In a bowl, mix chicken, cucumber, olives, feta, yogurt, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Spread onto flatbreads, roll up, and slice if desired.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.

bbq_chickpea_stuffed_sweet_potatoes.name: BBQ Chickpea Stuffed Sweet Potatoes
bbq_chickpea_stuffed_sweet_potatoes.description: Baked sweet potatoes filled with smoky BBQ chickpeas and a creamy avocado drizzle — hearty and vegan.
instructions: Bake sweet potatoes at 400°F for 30 minutes until tender.
Toss chickpeas with BBQ sauce and heat in a skillet until warmed through.
Mash avocado with lime juice, salt, and pepper.
Slice sweet potatoes open and stuff with BBQ chickpeas.
Drizzle with mashed avocado before serving.

buffalo_chicken_lettuce_wraps.name: Buffalo Chicken Lettuce Wraps
buffalo_chicken_lettuce_wraps.description: Spicy buffalo chicken tucked into crisp lettuce cups for a low-carb, gluten-free lunch.
ingredients: 8 large lettuce leaves (romaine or butter lettuce)
Optional: ranch or blue cheese dressing (gluten-free)
instructions: Toss chicken with buffalo sauce in a bowl.
Spoon chicken into lettuce leaves.
Top with carrots, celery, and a drizzle of ranch if using.
Serve immediately.

tuna_salad_cucumber_boats.name: Tuna Salad Cucumber Boats
tuna_salad_cucumber_boats.description: Light and crunchy cucumber boats filled with simple Whole30-approved tuna salad.
instructions: Mix tuna, mayo, onion, celery, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
Slice cucumber in half lengthwise and scoop out some seeds to make boats.
Fill cucumber boats with tuna salad.
Serve immediately.

caprese_grilled_cheese.name: Caprese Grilled Cheese
caprese_grilled_cheese.description: A fresh twist on classic grilled cheese with mozzarella, tomatoes, and basil on buttery toasted bread.
instructions: Butter one side of each slice of bread.
On the non-buttered side, layer mozzarella, tomato, and basil.
Top with another slice of bread, buttered side out.
Grill in a skillet over medium heat until golden and cheese melts.
Slice and serve warm.

italian_tuna_salad_olives.name: Italian Tuna Salad with Olives
italian_tuna_salad_olives.description: A light and briny tuna salad packed with Mediterranean flavors — olives, capers, and fresh herbs.
ingredients: 1 (5 oz) can tuna in olive oil (drained)
instructions: In a bowl, combine tuna, olives, capers, cucumber, and tomatoes.
Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.
Toss gently and sprinkle with parsley.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.

vegan_italian_pasta_salad.name: Vegan Italian Pasta Salad
vegan_italian_pasta_salad.description: A colorful vegan pasta salad tossed with a zesty Italian vinaigrette and crunchy vegetables.
instructions: Cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain and rinse under cold water.
In a large bowl, combine pasta, vegetables, and olives.
Pour dressing over and toss to coat.
Chill for 15 minutes before serving.

grilled_eggplant_mozzarella_stack.name: Grilled Eggplant and Mozzarella Stack
grilled_eggplant_mozzarella_stack.description: Layers of smoky grilled eggplant, fresh mozzarella, and basil for a gluten-free Italian lunch.
instructions: Brush eggplant slices with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Grill over medium heat for 3-4 minutes per side until tender.
Layer grilled eggplant, mozzarella, and basil into small stacks.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze if desired before serving.

whole30_italian_chicken_salad.name: Italian Chicken Salad
whole30_italian_chicken_salad.description: Shredded chicken, olives, artichokes, and herbs tossed in a lemony Whole30-approved vinaigrette.
ingredients: 1/4 cup marinated artichoke hearts (drained and chopped)
instructions: In a bowl, combine chicken, olives, and artichokes.
Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.
Sprinkle oregano, salt, and pepper.
Toss gently and serve chilled or at room temperature.

tomato_basil_gnocchi.name: Tomato Basil Gnocchi
tomato_basil_gnocchi.description: Pillowy gnocchi tossed with a fresh tomato basil sauce — simple and comforting Italian lunch.
instructions: Cook gnocchi according to package instructions, then drain.
In a skillet, heat olive oil and sauté garlic until fragrant.
Add cherry tomatoes and cook for 3-5 minutes.
Toss in gnocchi and basil. Season with salt and pepper.
Sprinkle with Parmesan if using before serving.

italian_herb_grilled_chicken.name: Italian Herb Grilled Chicken Thighs
italian_herb_grilled_chicken.description: Juicy grilled chicken thighs marinated with olive oil, lemon, and Italian herbs — a clean, paleo-friendly lunch.
instructions: In a bowl, mix olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, basil, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Coat the chicken thighs in the marinade and let sit for at least 20 minutes.
Grill over medium heat for 6-7 minutes per side until fully cooked.
Serve warm with a side salad or grilled vegetables.

zucchini_noodles_carbonara.name: Zucchini Noodles Carbonara
zucchini_noodles_carbonara.description: A keto twist on classic carbonara using zucchini noodles, creamy egg sauce, and crispy pancetta.
instructions: Cook pancetta in a skillet over medium heat until crispy. Remove and set aside.
Sauté zucchini noodles briefly in pancetta fat until slightly softened (about 2 minutes).
In a bowl, whisk eggs, Parmesan, cream, salt, and pepper.
Remove skillet from heat and toss in the egg mixture, stirring quickly to create a creamy sauce.
Top with crispy pancetta and serve immediately.

mediterranean_mexican_bowl.name: Mediterranean-Mexican Fusion Bowl
mediterranean_mexican_bowl.description: A vibrant bowl with Mexican spices and Mediterranean veggies — a zesty fusion perfect for lunch.
instructions: In a bowl, layer quinoa, black beans, cucumber, and tomatoes.
Drizzle with olive oil and lime juice.
Top with feta and cilantro before serving.

vegan_mexican_burrito_bowl.name: Vegan Mexican Burrito Bowl
vegan_mexican_burrito_bowl.description: A hearty vegan burrito bowl loaded with rice, beans, salsa, and fresh avocado.
instructions: Layer rice, beans, corn, and salsa in a bowl.
Top with sliced avocado and cilantro.
Serve immediately.

gluten_free_chicken_tacos.name: Gluten-Free Chicken Tacos
gluten_free_chicken_tacos.description: Simple and flavorful chicken tacos using gluten-free corn tortillas.
instructions: Season and cook chicken until done, then shred.
Warm tortillas and fill with chicken, lettuce, and tomatoes.
Top with salsa and serve.

whole30_mexican_chicken_salad.name: Mexican Chicken Salad
whole30_mexican_chicken_salad.description: A clean Mexican chicken salad with crisp veggies, compliant with Whole30.
instructions: In a bowl, mix chicken, bell pepper, cucumber, and onion.
Drizzle with olive oil and lime juice.
Toss and season with salt and pepper.

vegetarian_mexican_quinoa.name: Vegetarian Mexican Quinoa
vegetarian_mexican_quinoa.description: A satisfying vegetarian quinoa dish packed with black beans, corn, and Mexican spices.
instructions: In a skillet, heat olive oil and add cumin.
Add beans, corn, and tomatoes. Cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in quinoa and cook for another 3-5 minutes.

paleo_mexican_cauliflower_rice.name: Paleo Mexican Cauliflower Rice
paleo_mexican_cauliflower_rice.description: A low-carb paleo-friendly cauliflower rice with Mexican spices and fresh veggies.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a pan and sauté onion and peppers.
Add cauliflower rice and spices.
Cook until cauliflower is tender, about 5-7 minutes.

keto_mexican_avocado_chicken.name: Keto Mexican Avocado Chicken
keto_mexican_avocado_chicken.description: A creamy keto-friendly Mexican chicken stuffed into ripe avocados for a high-fat, low-carb lunch.
instructions: Mix chicken, tomatoes, mayo, and lime juice.
Spoon mixture into avocado halves.
Top with cilantro and serve immediately.

mediterranean_asian_salmon_bowl.name: Mediterranean-Asian Salmon Bowl
mediterranean_asian_salmon_bowl.description: A delicious fusion of Mediterranean herbs and Asian flavors over salmon and rice.
instructions: Brush salmon with olive oil, soy sauce, and sprinkle with sesame seeds.
Bake at 375°F for 15-20 minutes until cooked through.
Serve salmon over rice, topped with cucumber and avocado slices.
Drizzle lemon juice over everything before serving.

vegan_asian_noodle_salad.name: Vegan Asian Noodle Salad
vegan_asian_noodle_salad.description: A light and colorful noodle salad packed with veggies and a savory sesame dressing.
instructions: Cook noodles according to package instructions and rinse with cold water.
Toss noodles with cabbage, carrots, and cucumber.
Whisk soy sauce, sesame oil, rice vinegar, and maple syrup for dressing.
Pour dressing over salad and toss to combine.

gluten_free_asian_lettuce_wraps.name: Gluten-Free Asian Lettuce Wraps
gluten_free_asian_lettuce_wraps.description: Crisp lettuce wraps filled with savory ground turkey and vegetables.
instructions: Cook turkey until browned. Add mushrooms, water chestnuts, ginger, and tamari.
Stir and cook for another 5 minutes.
Scoop filling into lettuce leaves and serve.

whole30_asian_chicken_salad.name: Asian Chicken Salad
whole30_asian_chicken_salad.description: A crunchy, refreshing chicken salad with a tangy ginger-lime dressing.
instructions: Combine chicken, cabbage, carrots, and almonds in a bowl.
Whisk olive oil, lime juice, and ginger for dressing.
Toss salad with dressing and season with salt and pepper.

vegetarian_asian_rice_bowl.name: Vegetarian Asian Rice Bowl
vegetarian_asian_rice_bowl.description: A hearty rice bowl filled with colorful vegetables and a soy-ginger sauce.
instructions: Stir-fry broccoli, snap peas, and bell peppers in sesame oil.
Add soy sauce and ginger.
Serve veggies over rice.

paleo_asian_shrimp_stir_fry.name: Paleo Asian Shrimp Stir Fry
paleo_asian_shrimp_stir_fry.description: A quick and clean shrimp stir fry with crunchy vegetables.
instructions: Heat coconut oil in a pan.
Sauté shrimp until pink, about 4 minutes.
Add vegetables and coconut aminos, stir-fry for 5-7 minutes.
Serve hot.

keto_asian_egg_roll_bowl.name: Keto Asian Egg Roll in a Bowl
keto_asian_egg_roll_bowl.description: All the flavor of an egg roll without the carbs, packed into a quick keto stir-fry.
instructions: Cook ground pork in a skillet until browned.
Add garlic, ginger, cabbage, and carrots.
Stir in soy sauce and sesame oil.
Cook until cabbage is tender, about 5-7 minutes.

mediterranean_chicken_pita.name: Mediterranean Chicken Pita
mediterranean_chicken_pita.description: Juicy chicken stuffed into a pita with crisp veggies and creamy tzatziki.
instructions: Stuff pita pockets with chicken, cucumber, tomatoes, and onion.
Drizzle with olive oil and tzatziki.
Season with salt and pepper, and serve.

vegan_mediterranean_grain_bowl.name: Vegan Mediterranean Grain Bowl
vegan_mediterranean_grain_bowl.description: A hearty vegan grain bowl with quinoa, chickpeas, and lemon-herb dressing.
instructions: Combine quinoa, chickpeas, cucumber, and tomatoes in a bowl.
Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.
Top with parsley and serve.

gluten_free_mediterranean_salmon_salad.name: Gluten-Free Mediterranean Salmon Salad
gluten_free_mediterranean_salmon_salad.description: Fresh greens topped with lemon herb salmon and Mediterranean vegetables.
instructions: Season and bake salmon at 375°F for 15-20 minutes.
Toss greens, cucumber, and tomatoes with olive oil and lemon juice.
Top with baked salmon and serve.

whole30_mediterranean_chicken_bowl.name: Mediterranean Chicken Bowl
whole30_mediterranean_chicken_bowl.description: A clean and fresh chicken and veggie bowl with zesty lemon dressing.
instructions: Assemble greens, chicken, cucumber, tomatoes, and avocado in a bowl.
Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.
Serve immediately.

vegetarian_mediterranean_flatbread.name: Vegetarian Mediterranean Flatbread
vegetarian_mediterranean_flatbread.description: A crispy flatbread topped with veggies, hummus, and feta cheese.
instructions: Spread hummus over flatbreads.
Top with cucumber, tomatoes, and feta.
Drizzle with olive oil and serve.

paleo_mediterranean_stuffed_peppers.name: Paleo Mediterranean Stuffed Peppers
paleo_mediterranean_stuffed_peppers.description: Bell peppers stuffed with seasoned ground turkey and vegetables.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Cook turkey with zucchini, tomatoes, olive oil, and oregano.
Stuff peppers with mixture and bake for 20-25 minutes.

keto_mediterranean_chicken_salad.name: Keto Mediterranean Chicken Salad
keto_mediterranean_chicken_salad.description: A low-carb salad with juicy chicken, olives, feta, and creamy dressing.
instructions: Combine chicken, cucumber, olives, and feta in a bowl.
Toss with olive oil and lemon juice.
Season with salt and pepper, and serve.

mediterranean_hawaiian_grilled_chicken.name: Mediterranean Hawaiian Grilled Chicken
mediterranean_hawaiian_grilled_chicken.description: Grilled chicken with a tropical pineapple salsa and Mediterranean herbs.
instructions: Season chicken with salt, pepper, olive oil, and lemon juice.
Grill chicken until cooked through (6-7 minutes per side).
Mix pineapple, red onion, and parsley for salsa.
Top grilled chicken with pineapple salsa before serving.

vegan_hawaiian_tofu_bowl.name: Vegan Hawaiian Tofu Bowl
vegan_hawaiian_tofu_bowl.description: A tropical bowl of marinated tofu, rice, and fresh pineapple.
instructions: Marinate tofu in soy sauce, sesame oil, and maple syrup for 10 minutes.
Pan-fry tofu until golden on all sides.
Serve tofu over rice with pineapple on top.

gluten_free_hawaiian_shrimp_bowl.name: Gluten-Free Hawaiian Shrimp Bowl
gluten_free_hawaiian_shrimp_bowl.description: Garlicky shrimp served over coconut rice and pineapple.
instructions: Sauté garlic in olive oil until fragrant.
Add shrimp, cook until pink (3-4 minutes).
Serve shrimp over coconut rice with pineapple.

whole30_hawaiian_chicken_salad.name: Hawaiian Chicken Salad
whole30_hawaiian_chicken_salad.description: A light chicken salad with pineapple, coconut, and Whole30-friendly mayo.
instructions: Mix chicken, pineapple, and coconut.
Stir in mayonnaise and season with salt and pepper.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.

vegetarian_hawaiian_fried_rice.name: Vegetarian Hawaiian Fried Rice
vegetarian_hawaiian_fried_rice.description: A sweet and savory fried rice with pineapple and vegetables.
instructions: Heat sesame oil in a wok.
Stir-fry carrots and peas until tender.
Add rice and pineapple, stir-fry and season with soy sauce.

paleo_hawaiian_grilled_fish.name: Paleo Hawaiian Grilled Fish
paleo_hawaiian_grilled_fish.description: Simply grilled white fish served with fresh pineapple salsa.
instructions: Season fish with salt, pepper, and olive oil.
Grill fish 4-5 minutes per side until cooked through.
Mix pineapple and cilantro with lime juice for salsa.
Top grilled fish with pineapple salsa.

keto_hawaiian_chicken_skewers.name: Keto Hawaiian Chicken Skewers
keto_hawaiian_chicken_skewers.description: Low-carb chicken and veggie skewers marinated in tropical flavors.
instructions: Marinate chicken in coconut aminos, olive oil, and garlic powder for 15 minutes.
Thread chicken, peppers, and pineapple onto skewers.
Grill skewers for 8-10 minutes, turning occasionally.

mediterranean_american_herb_chicken.name: Mediterranean American Herb Chicken
mediterranean_american_herb_chicken.description: Herb-marinated chicken grilled American-style with Mediterranean flavors.
instructions: Marinate chicken in olive oil, herbs, lemon juice, salt, and pepper for 20 minutes.
Grill over medium heat for 6-7 minutes per side or until cooked through.
Serve with lemon wedges.

vegan_bbq_jackfruit_sandwich.name: Vegan BBQ Jackfruit Sandwich
vegan_bbq_jackfruit_sandwich.description: Tender pulled jackfruit tossed in smoky barbecue sauce, served on a bun.
ingredients: 2 cans young green jackfruit (drained and shredded)
instructions: Sauté jackfruit in olive oil until slightly crispy.
Stir in BBQ sauce and simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve on buns with sliced onion.

gluten_free_bbq_chicken_plate.name: Gluten-Free BBQ Chicken Plate
gluten_free_bbq_chicken_plate.description: Classic BBQ chicken thighs without the gluten, served with slaw.
instructions: Season and grill chicken, basting with BBQ sauce.
Mix coleslaw with mayo, vinegar, salt, and pepper.
Serve chicken with slaw.

whole30_burger_bowl.name: Burger Bowl
whole30_burger_bowl.description: Burger patties over a bed of greens, avocado, and pickles for a bun-free dinner.
instructions: Cook burger patties to desired doneness.
Assemble greens, avocado, and pickles in a bowl.
Top with burger patties and drizzle with olive oil.

vegetarian_sweet_potato_black_bean_burge.name: Vegetarian Sweet Potato Black Bean Burgers
vegetarian_sweet_potato_black_bean_burge.description: Hearty black bean and sweet potato patties perfect for a vegetarian burger night.
instructions: Mash sweet potato and black beans together.
Mix in breadcrumbs, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Form into patties and bake at 375°F for 20-25 minutes, flipping halfway.

paleo_balsamic_skirt_steak.name: Paleo Balsamic Skirt Steak
paleo_balsamic_skirt_steak.description: Tender skirt steak marinated in balsamic vinegar and grilled to perfection.
instructions: Marinate steak in balsamic vinegar, olive oil, garlic powder, salt, and pepper for 15 minutes.
Grill for 3-4 minutes per side for medium-rare.
Rest 5 minutes before slicing.

keto_cheddar_bacon_meatloaf.name: Keto Cheddar Bacon Meatloaf
keto_cheddar_bacon_meatloaf.description: A rich, low-carb meatloaf packed with cheddar cheese and smoky bacon.
instructions: Mix all ingredients and form into a loaf.
Bake at 375°F for 35-40 minutes.
Let rest before slicing and serving.

mediterranean_chicken_piccata.name: Mediterranean Chicken Piccata
mediterranean_chicken_piccata.description: Tender chicken breasts simmered in a lemon-caper sauce for a light Mediterranean-style dinner.
instructions: Season chicken with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil and cook chicken until golden.
Add broth, lemon juice, and capers. Simmer 8-10 minutes.
Serve hot with fresh parsley.

vegan_italian_stuffed_peppers.name: Vegan Italian Stuffed Peppers
vegan_italian_stuffed_peppers.description: Bell peppers stuffed with a hearty mix of rice, tomatoes, and Italian herbs.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Sauté onion, add tomatoes, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Mix with rice and stuff into peppers.
Bake for 30 minutes until tender.

gluten_free_italian_baked_chicken.name: Gluten-Free Italian Baked Chicken
gluten_free_italian_baked_chicken.description: Baked chicken thighs with Italian seasoning and a tomato-basil topping.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Season chicken and place in a baking dish.
Top with tomatoes, basil, and drizzle olive oil.
Bake for 30-35 minutes until cooked through.

whole30_italian_sausage_skillet.name: Italian Sausage Skillet
whole30_italian_sausage_skillet.description: A one-pan Whole30 dinner with sausage, peppers, onions, and tomatoes.
instructions: Heat olive oil in skillet.
Brown sausages, then add peppers, onions, and tomatoes.
Cook until veggies are tender and sausage is cooked through.

vegetarian_spinach_ricotta_stuffed_shell.name: Vegetarian Spinach Ricotta Stuffed Shells
vegetarian_spinach_ricotta_stuffed_shell.description: Pasta shells filled with creamy spinach-ricotta mix and baked in marinara sauce.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Cook shells al dente.
Mix ricotta, spinach, salt, and pepper.
Stuff shells and place in a baking dish with marinara sauce.
Top with mozzarella and bake for 20 minutes.

paleo_italian_basil_chicken.name: Paleo Italian Basil Chicken
paleo_italian_basil_chicken.description: Seared chicken thighs with a fresh basil and tomato pan sauce.
instructions: Heat olive oil and cook chicken until browned.
Add cherry tomatoes and cook until blistered.
Stir in fresh basil before serving.

keto_creamy_tuscan_salmon.name: Keto Creamy Tuscan Salmon
keto_creamy_tuscan_salmon.description: Pan-seared salmon in a rich, creamy sauce with spinach and sun-dried tomatoes.
instructions: Pan-sear salmon and remove.
In the same pan, add cream, spinach, and sun-dried tomatoes.
Simmer and return salmon to finish cooking in sauce.

mediterranean_mexican_grilled_chicken_sa.name: Mediterranean Mexican Grilled Chicken Salad
mediterranean_mexican_grilled_chicken_sa.description: Grilled chicken over greens with avocado, tomatoes, and a citrus vinaigrette blending Mediterranean and Mexican flavors.
instructions: Grill chicken and slice.
Arrange greens, avocado, and tomatoes.
Top with chicken and drizzle with olive oil and lime juice.
Season and serve.

vegan_mushroom_tacos.name: Vegan Mushroom Tacos
vegan_mushroom_tacos.description: Savory mushroom tacos loaded with seasoned sautéed mushrooms, avocado, and salsa.
instructions: Sauté mushrooms with olive oil, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Warm tortillas and fill with mushrooms, avocado, and salsa.
Serve hot.

gluten_free_chicken_fajita_plate.name: Gluten-Free Chicken Fajita Plate
gluten_free_chicken_fajita_plate.description: Sizzling chicken fajitas served without tortillas over a colorful bed of veggies.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a skillet.
Cook chicken until browned, add veggies and fajita seasoning.
Cook until tender-crisp and serve.

whole30_mexican_shrimp_bowl.name: Mexican Shrimp Bowl
whole30_mexican_shrimp_bowl.description: Spiced shrimp served over cauliflower rice with avocado and fresh salsa.
instructions: Season shrimp and sauté in olive oil until pink.
Heat cauliflower rice separately.
Assemble bowls with rice, shrimp, avocado, and salsa.

vegetarian_black_bean_enchiladas.name: Vegetarian Black Bean Enchiladas
vegetarian_black_bean_enchiladas.description: Cheesy enchiladas stuffed with black beans and veggies, baked in red enchilada sauce.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Mix beans, peppers, and onion.
Fill tortillas, roll up, place in a baking dish.
Top with sauce and cheese. Bake for 20-25 minutes.

paleo_mexican_chicken_thighs.name: Paleo Mexican Chicken Thighs
paleo_mexican_chicken_thighs.description: Spicy, juicy chicken thighs pan-seared with smoky paprika and cumin.
instructions: Season chicken with spices.
Sear in olive oil over medium-high heat.
Cook for 6-7 minutes per side until fully cooked.

keto_mexican_cheeseburger_salad.name: Keto Mexican Cheeseburger Salad
keto_mexican_cheeseburger_salad.description: A bold keto cheeseburger bowl with spiced ground beef, cheese, avocado, and salsa.
instructions: Cook beef with taco seasoning.
Arrange lettuce, top with beef, avocado, cheese, and salsa.
Serve immediately.

vegan_vegetable_curry.name: Vegan Vegetable Curry
vegan_vegetable_curry.description: A creamy coconut milk curry packed with vibrant veggies and spices.
instructions: Sauté veggies in olive oil.
Add curry paste and coconut milk.
Simmer until vegetables are tender.

gluten_free_chicken_teriyaki.name: Gluten-Free Chicken Teriyaki
gluten_free_chicken_teriyaki.description: Juicy chicken coated in a homemade gluten-free teriyaki sauce.
instructions: Cook chicken until golden.
Simmer soy sauce, honey, vinegar, sesame oil, and garlic.
Coat chicken with sauce and serve.

whole30_stir_fry_beef_and_broccoli.name: Stir-Fry Beef and Broccoli
whole30_stir_fry_beef_and_broccoli.description: Quick beef stir-fry with crisp broccoli and a simple coconut aminos sauce.
instructions: Sauté beef in olive oil.
Add broccoli and garlic.
Stir in coconut aminos and cook until tender.

vegetarian_pad_thai.name: Vegetarian Pad Thai
vegetarian_pad_thai.description: A lighter version of Pad Thai with tofu, vegetables, and a sweet-savory sauce.
instructions: Cook noodles according to package.
Sauté tofu until golden.
Add noodles, veggies, tamarind, and soy sauce.
Toss and serve hot.

paleo_asian_ginger_chicken.name: Paleo Asian Ginger Chicken
paleo_asian_ginger_chicken.description: Flavorful chicken thighs marinated in ginger and coconut aminos, then grilled.
instructions: Marinate chicken in coconut aminos, ginger, salt, and pepper.
Grill or sear over medium-high heat until cooked through.
Serve with optional sautéed greens.

keto_asian_beef_lettuce_wraps.name: Keto Asian Beef Lettuce Wraps
